justification: “To date, the most widely and successfully applied model of two-choice decisions is the diffusion decision model (Ratcliff, 1978; Ratcliff & McKoon, 2008)….”
“I present and evaluate a new diffusion model of two-choice decision making, the linear-drift, linear infinitesimal variance (LDLIV) model….”
“…the diffusion decision model … represents evidence accumulation as a Wiener, or Brownian motion, process.”

“Several researchers have investigated models in which evidence for competing alternatives is modeled by racing diffusion processes … Ratcliff et al. (2007) and Smith & Ratcliff (2009) called these models dual diffusion models.”
